definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)

sentences.english: Her husband could be freed on bail within months.
sentences.chinese: 她的丈夫有在幾個月內交保釋放。

sentences.english: Mrs. Pojaman was convicted last month of tax evasion and released on bail.
sentences.chinese: 他信夫人上個月被認定犯有逃稅罪，交保候審。

sentences.english: The trial was adjourned until March 10th, and Jahnke was released on bail.
sentences.chinese: 法庭暫停審判直到3月10號，揚克交保釋放。

sentences.english: The suspect jumped bail and left the state.
sentences.chinese: 嫌疑犯在交保後逃出了本州。

sentences.english: All have been released on bail without charge.
sentences.chinese: 所有被拘捕的人都交保釋放，沒有受到指控。

definition: to apply to a court for an arrest warrant
to make a formal request/formal request/to make a claim (law)
to judge a case/to render a verdict/verdict
to defraud/to obtain by fraud/to embezzle/fraudulent
